definitions.definition: A roving motion; course without definite direction; lack of rule or method; chance.
The full range of a bullet or other projectile; hence, the angle at which a weapon is tilted to allow the greatest range.
An undefined, unknown or unimportant person; a person of no consequence.
definitions.example: The party was boring. It was full of randoms.

definitions.definition: Having unpredictable outcomes and, in the ideal case, all outcomes equally probable; resulting from such selection; lacking statistical correlation.
definitions.example: The flip of a fair coin is purely random.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to probability distribution.
definitions.example: A toss of loaded dice is still random, though biased.

definitions.definition: Pseudorandom; mimicking the result of random selection.
(somewhat colloquial) Representative and undistinguished; typical and average; selected for no particular reason.
definitions.example: A random American off the street couldn't tell the difference.

definitions.definition: (somewhat colloquial) Apropos of nothing; lacking context; unexpected; having apparent lack of plan, cause or reason.
definitions.example: That was a completely random comment.

definitions.definition: Characterized by or often saying random things; habitually using non sequiturs.
